Description: La derniere Pyramide en remontant le Nil, one of two studies for Plate 62 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; two Egyptians seated near the ruins of a small pyramid near the river Nile, a goat at r Pen and grey ink, with grey wash, touched with white (partly discoloured); on tracing paper
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Prevost. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
